summary: This is an FBI Daily News Briefing email from July 28, 2023, summarizing major news stories. It includes a brief mention that Jeffrey Epstein victims plan to sue the FBI for $600 million for failing to investigate past reports of sexual abuse, alongside numerous other unrelated news items about Trump investigations, criminal cases, and international events.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier and accused sex trafficker
persons.context: Mentioned as the prolific predator whose victims are planning to sue the FBI for failing to investigate him earlier.

persons.name: Maria Farmer
persons.context: One of the women abused by Jeffrey Epstein who, along with Sarah Ransome, filed a notice of claim against the FBI.

persons.name: Sarah Ransome
persons.context: One of the women abused by Jeffrey Epstein who, along with Maria Farmer, filed a notice of claim against the FBI.

persons.name: Jennifer Freeman
persons.context: Quoted in the article, stating the victims are seeking answers and accountability from the FBI for its failure to investigate Epstein.

persons.name: Donald Trump
persons.context: Extensively mentioned in the briefing regarding new charges in the classified documents case and a looming indictment related to the 2020 election interference probe.

persons.name: Jack Smith
persons.context: Oversees the federal investigations into Donald Trump's handling of classified documents and efforts to overturn the 2020 election.

persons.name: Carlos De Oliveira
persons.context: Charged alongside Trump in the updated indictment related to the alleged deletion of security footage at Mar-a-Lago.

persons.name: Walt Nauta
persons.context: Previously charged with Trump; mentioned in relation to moving boxes and discussions about security footage.

persons.name: John Irving
persons.context: Declined to comment on the new charges against his client.

persons.name: Ron DeSantis
persons.context: Vowed to fire FBI Director Christopher Wray if elected, citing alleged weaponization of the bureau.

persons.name: Christopher Wray
persons.context: Mentioned as the subject of Ron DeSantis's vow to fire him, and in a letter from Senator Rick Scott regarding a cyberattack investigation.

persons.name: Rick Scott
persons.context: Penned a letter to FBI Director Wray urging the FBI to prioritize the investigation of a cyberattack on Tampa General Hospital.

persons.name: Trey Gowdy
persons.context: Suggested by Senator Tim Scott as a potential replacement for FBI Director Christopher Wray.

persons.name: Tim Scott
persons.context: Suggested replacing FBI Director Wray with Trey Gowdy and commented on the Jan. 6 investigation's impact on GOP rivals.

persons.name: Merrick Garland
persons.context: Appointed Special Counsel Jack Smith; mentioned by Senator Tim Scott in the context of the DOJ.

persons.name: Mike Pence
persons.context: Mentioned in the context of the Jan. 6 committee findings and his testimony before the grand jury investigating election interference.

persons.name: Brad Raffensperger
persons.context: Mentioned regarding Trump's phone call asking him to 'find' votes, which is key evidence in the Georgia investigation.

persons.name: Fani Willis
persons.context: Oversees the Georgia grand jury investigation into Trump and his allies' attempts to overturn the 2020 election results.

persons.name: Jim Jordan
persons.role: U.S. Representative, House Judiciary Committee Chairman
persons.context: Released internal Facebook emails showing White House pressure on content moderation and invited Matt Taibbi to testify.

connections.description: Both are victims of Jeffrey Epstein who jointly filed a notice of claim against the FBI.
Maria Farmer was abused by Jeffrey Epstein in her youth.
Sarah Ransome was abused by Jeffrey Epstein in her youth.
Jennifer Freeman is a lawyer representing Epstein victims, including Maria Farmer and Sarah Ransome.
De Oliveira worked for Trump for nearly 20 years, currently as a property manager at Mar-a-Lago.
Nauta is a Trump aide involved in moving boxes at Mar-a-Lago.
Special Counsel Jack Smith is leading two federal criminal investigations targeting Donald Trump.
DeSantis vowed to fire FBI Director Wray on his first day in office if elected president.

events.title: Epstein Victims File Notice of Claim Against FBI
events.description: Maria Farmer and Sarah Ransome filed a notice of claim to the FBI, a prerequisite to suing the agency for $600 million for failing to investigate Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: New Charges Filed Against Trump in Documents Case
events.description: Prosecutors filed new charges against Donald Trump and added Carlos De Oliveira as a defendant, alleging obstruction related to the deletion of Mar-a-Lago security footage.

events.title: Trump's Lawyers Meet with Special Counsel Jack Smith
events.description: Donald Trump's defense lawyers met with Special Counsel Jack Smith regarding the potential indictment in the 2020 election interference probe.

events.title: January 6 Capitol Attack
events.description: Referenced multiple times in the context of ongoing investigations, potential indictments of Trump, and sentencing of rioters.

events.title: FBI Daily News Briefing Published
events.description: The FBI's Office of Public Affairs distributed its daily compilation of news stories.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein victims Maria Farmer and Sarah Ransome plan to sue the FBI for $600 million for failing to investigate reports of sexual abuse by Epstein for nearly 25 years.
The document is an FBI Daily News Briefing, showing the bureau's internal compilation of news, which includes a story critical of its own past inaction regarding Epstein.
The briefing covers a wide range of unrelated topics, with the Epstein item being a single entry among many concerning Trump investigations, criminal cases, and international news.
The notice of claim filed by the Epstein victims is a procedural step required before a lawsuit can be filed against a federal agency.
The attorney for the victims, Jennifer Freeman, explicitly connected the FBI's failure to act to decades of additional abuse suffered by Epstein's victims.
